question_text: Why do operating systems typically hide file sharing protocols from users?
answer_options: To improve security by obscuring network details
To simplify the user experience with drag-and-drop functionality
correct_answer: To simplify the user experience with drag-and-drop functionality
explanation: Operating systems hide protocols like SMB and AFP to provide users with a simple file management interface where they can drag, drop, rename, and modify files without knowing the underlying protocols.
